author: suburbandad_
content:
locally, besu w/snap is passing the hive sync simulator (`./hive -sim sync -client besu`).  Once pr 6894 merges (soon), it will simplify the diff to be a single parameter change for these tests to pass.

It is the snap protocol tests that we are failing the majority of due to response expectations.

There are a couple sources of difference for besu return counts/sizes when responding to snap requests.  The main issue is that, besu storage layer and apis make it cost prohibitive to honor exact soft request size limits, mostly due to the difference in encoding size between rlp and raw.  

The second source of diff is easier to address, we are sending raw empty code hash and empty root hash.  We can/will fix this account encoding, and that should get us closer to the hive snap test expectations.
